posts.post_content:
People of Ravnica, your attention, please. This is Chief Justiciar Leonos of the Azorius Senate. As you will no doubt be aware, the plans for development of the outlying regions of Ravnica require the building of a [guildgate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=guildgate). And regrettably, your district is one of those scheduled for demolition. The process will take slightly less than two minutes. Thank you.  
  
... There’s no point in acting surprised about it. All the planning charts and demolition orders have been on display at New Prahv for 2 years now, so you’ve had plenty of time to lodge any formal complaint and it’s far too late to start making a fuss about it now. … What do you mean you’ve never been to New Prahv? Oh, for heaven’s sake, it’s only down the road, right next to the [hallowed fountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hallowed fountain), you know. I’m sorry, but if you can’t be bothered to take an interest in local affairs, that’s your own lookout. Energize the [mizzium mortars](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mizzium mortars).
posts.html:
People of Ravnica, your attention, please. This is Chief Justiciar Leonos of the Azorius Senate. As you will no doubt be aware, the plans for development of the outlying regions of Ravnica require the building of a guildgate. And regrettably, your district is one of those scheduled for demolition. The process will take slightly less than two minutes. Thank you.

... There’s no point in acting surprised about it. All the planning charts and demolition orders have been on display at New Prahv for 2 years now, so you’ve had plenty of time to lodge any formal complaint and it’s far too late to start making a fuss about it now. … What do you mean you’ve never been to New Prahv? Oh, for heaven’s sake, it’s only down the road, right next to the hallowed fountain, you know. I’m sorry, but if you can’t be bothered to take an interest in local affairs, that’s your own lookout. Energize the mizzium mortars.

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (10/14/2012 5:37:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The argument that this is worse than Wrath of God because Wrath stops regeneration is a load of crap for two reasons:  
1) There are a lot of other field nukes that don't stop regeneration *that people still say are good*.   
2) How likely is it that your opponent will have the ability to regenerate his entire field after Supreme Verdict is cast? Not very, considering how many creatures don't get access to regeneration.  
  
Really, the mana cost is the only thing that make it "bad."
posts.html:

2) How likely is it that your opponent will have the ability to regenerate his entire field after Supreme Verdict is cast? Not very, considering how many creatures don't get access to regeneration.

Really, the mana cost is the only thing that make it "bad."

posts.post_content:
I wish it Exiled all creatures, as there are \*plenty\* of ways to dodge this,  
but what can you do?  
  
It's still a great Control spell,  
with some of the best art I've ever seen on a Magic card.  
  
Welcome back, usable sweepers!  
[Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus) is great and all, but a reliable turn 4 wipe is something we pretty much always need in Standard.

Posted By: CORRBentOrgy (11/26/2012 8:41:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm confused by how everyone rates these cards. Wrath of God and Damnation are both rated 5 stars. Supreme Verdict can't be countered and gets a lower rating? What are you all smoking?  
  
Someone mentioned a Golgari charm. Sure, that ONE card would screw this... But compare that to how many [counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=counterspell) cards there are in magic.... Wrath and Damnation have far more common cards which could easily [negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=negate), [rewind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rewind), [deprive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=deprive), [cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cancel) or [dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dissipate) them....  
  
Once this rotates out of Standard and into Modern and extended, I think the value and power of this spell will surpass Wrath and Damnation.
posts.html:
I'm confused by how everyone rates these cards. Wrath of God and Damnation are both rated 5 stars. Supreme Verdict can't be countered and gets a lower rating? What are you all smoking?

Someone mentioned a Golgari charm. Sure, that ONE card would screw this... But compare that to how many counterspell cards there are in magic.... Wrath and Damnation have far more common cards which could easily negate, rewind, deprive, cancel or dissipate them....

Once this rotates out of Standard and into Modern and extended, I think the value and power of this spell will surpass Wrath and Damnation.

Posted By: NagrusD (11/10/2012 7:57:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Trygon\_Predator:  
  
Sick Douglas Adams reference there.  
  
I don't understand why this card is rated so low. It's the only 4-mana mass removal in the format with no drawbacks in its text box. Compare to [Barter in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barter in Blood), Mutilate, Sever the Bloodline, Divine Reckoning, and Terminus. Barter can only get 2 of theirs, [Mutilate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mutilate) implies a heavy dependence on [Swamps](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamps), Sever targets and only sweeps guys with the same name, [Divine Reckoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divine Reckoning) leaves one guy left standing on each side, and [Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus) has a really, really variable cost in a format lacking [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder).  
  
Plus, there's always the chance your opponent on MTGO can misclick and blow a [Dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dissipate), [Syncopate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Syncopate), or [Negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Negate) on this.
posts.html:
@ Trygon_Predator:

Sick Douglas Adams reference there.

I don't understand why this card is rated so low. It's the only 4-mana mass removal in the format with no drawbacks in its text box. Compare to Barter in Blood, Mutilate, Sever the Bloodline, Divine Reckoning, and Terminus. Barter can only get 2 of theirs, Mutilate implies a heavy dependence on Swamps, Sever targets and only sweeps guys with the same name, Divine Reckoning leaves one guy left standing on each side, and Terminus has a really, really variable cost in a format lacking Ponder.

Plus, there's always the chance your opponent on MTGO can misclick and blow a Dissipate, Syncopate, or Negate on this.
